null.verse 12:28: A když manžel uviděl, že košile vzadu je roztržena, zvolal: "Tohle je věru jeden z vašich ženských úkladů, vždyť lest vaše zajisté je nesmírná!
null.verse 12:29: Josefe, odvrať mysl svou od toho a ty, ženo, pros za odpuštění viny své, neboť jsi vskutku žena hříšná!"
null.verse 12:30: A říkaly ženy v městě tom: "Velmožova žena sváděla mladého sluhu svého, jenž vzbudil lásku vášnivou v ní.
null.verse 12:31: Když uslyšela jejich pomluvy lstivé, poslala k nim a připravila pro ně pomeranče a každé z nich pak dala nůž.
null.verse 12:32: Pravila: "Toto je ten, kvůli němuž jste mne hanily.
null.verse 12:33: I zvolal Josef: "Pane můj, vězení je mi milejší než to, k čemu mne vyzývají.
null.verse 12:34: I vyslyšel jej Pán jeho a odvrátil od něho úklady jejich - a On zajisté je slyšící i vševědoucí.
null.verse 12:35: Později, když viděli znamení, se jim uzdálo, aby jej na čas uvěznili.
null.verse 12:36: A spolu s ním přišli do vězení dva mladící a jeden z nich prohlásil: "Viděl jsem se ve snu, jak víno vytlačuji.
null.verse 12:37: I odpověděl: "Předtím než dostanete stravu, jež vám je dávána, sdělím vám výklad toho, dříve než ony sny se uskuteční.
null.verse 12:38: Pak následoval jsem náboženství předků svých, Abrahama, Izáka a Jakuba.
null.verse 12:39: Přátelé moji vězeňští, jsou snad rozdělení páni lepší než Bůh jediný, vše podmaňující?
null.verse 12:40: Ti, které uctíváte vedle Něho, nejsou leč jména, jež dali jste jim vy i otcové vaši, a Bůh ohledně nich neseslal žádné zplnomocnění.
null.verse 12:41: Přátelé moji vězeňští, jeden z vás bude napájet pána svého vínem, a pokud o druhého jde, ten bude ukřižován a ptáci mu budou klovat do hlavy.
null.verse 12:42: A řekl tomu, o němž se domníval, že bude zachráněn: "Zmiň se o mně pánu svému!" Však satan způsobil, že zapomněl vzpomenout Pána svého, a Josef zůstal několik let ve vězení.
null.verse 12:43: Pravil král: "Viděl jsem ve snu sedm tučných krav, jež požíralo sedm krav hubených; a viděl jsem sedm zelených klasů a sedm klasů uschlých.
null.verse 12:44: I řekli: "Popletené sny to jsou a my ve výkladu snů se nevyznáme.
null.verse 12:45: Tu pravil ten, jenž zachránil se z těch dvou vězňů, vzpomenul si po čase: "Já sdělím vám výklad toho snu, pošlete-li mne.
null.verse 12:46: Josefe spravedlivý, vylož nám sen o sedmi kravách tučných, jež budou sežrány sedmi kravami hubenými, a sen o sedmi klasech zelených a sedmi klasech uschlých! Možná, že k lidem se vrátím a možná že vědět budou.
null.verse 12:47: Odpověděl Josef: "Budete sít sedm let podle zvyku svého a to, co sklidíte, ponecháte v klasech kromě té malé části, již sníte.
null.verse 12:48: A poté později přijde sedm let suchých, jež pozrou vše, co předtím jste shromáždili, kromě malé části, již stranou uschováte.
null.verse 12:49: A po tomto přijde jeden rok, v němž lidem dostane se deště a v němž opět tlačit víno budou!"
null.verse 12:50: A poručil král: "Přiveďte ho!" Když přišel posel k Josefovi, řekl mu tento: "Vrať se k pánu svému a zeptej se ho, jaké byly záměry těch žen, jež ruce si pořezaly.
null.verse 12:51: Král pak otázal se těch žen: "Jaké byly vaše úmysly, když Josefa jste sváděly?" Odpověděly: "Chraň nás Bůh, my nic špatného o něm nevíme.
null.verse 12:52: A tak je to, aby věděl, že jsem jej neoklamal ohledně skrytého a že Bůh nepřivede úklad proradných ke zdaru.
null.verse 12:53: Netvrdím, že duše má je nevinná, vždyť věru duše neustále nabádá ke špatnostem, pokud se Pán můj neslituje - a Pán můj věru je odpouštějící, slitovný.
null.verse 12:54: I pravil král: "Přiveďte mi jej, já hodlám si jej pro sebe podržet!" A když s ním promluvil, prohlásil: "Ode dneška budeš mít u nás postavení vysoké i důvěru.
null.verse 12:55: I odpověděl Josef: "Pověř mne správou nad sýpkami země, neb já strážce jsem pečlivý a moudrý.
null.verse 12:56: A takto jsme upevnili Josefovo postavení v zemi té a mohl se usadit, kdekoli se mu zachtělo.
null.verse 12:57: Však odměna života onoho lepší je pro ty, kdož uvěřili a byli bohabojní.
null.verse 12:58: A přišli Josefovi bratři a vešli k němu; i poznal je, však oni jeho nepoznali.
null.verse 12:59: A když je zaopatřil zásobami jejich, pravil: "Přiveďte mi jednoho bratra svého od otce vašeho.
null.verse 12:60: Jestliže však jej ke mně nepřivedete, nedostane se vám ode mne míry obilí a nebudete ke mně připuštěni!"
null.verse 12:61: Odpověděli: "Požádáme o něj otce jeho a určitě tak uděláme.
null.verse 12:62: A řekl Josef sluhům svým: "Dejte jim zboží jejich do zavazadel, snad poznají je po příchodu k rodině své a možná že se navrátí.
null.verse 12:63: A když vrátili se k otci svému, řekli mu: "Otče náš, byla nám odmítnuta míra obilí.
null.verse 12:64: Odpověděl: "Což vaše ochrana bude jiná než předchozí ochrana jeho bratra? Však Bůh nejlepší je z ochránců a nejslitovnější ze slitovníků!"
null.verse 12:65: Když otevřeli svá zavazadla a shledali, že zboží jejich jim bylo navráceno, zvolali: "Otče náš, co více si přát? Toto naše zboží bylo nám vráceno a my zásobíme rodinu svou; ochráníme bratra svého a dostaneme o náklad jednoho velblouda navíc a to bude náklad snadný.
null.verse 12:66: Pravil otec jejich: "Nepošlu jej s vámi, pokud se mi nezavážete úmluvou před Bohem, že mi jej nazpět přivedete, leda budete-li něčím obklopeni.
null.verse 12:67: A dodal: "Synové moji, nevcházejte do města jedinou branou, nýbrž vejděte branami různými; já nemohu vám v ničem pomoci proti Bohu, neboť rozhodnutí je věru jen u Boha.
null.verse 12:68: A když vešli do města tak, jak jim to poručil otec jejich, nepomohlo jim to nikterak proti Bohu.
null.verse 12:69: Když vstoupili k Josefovi, přitáhl blízko k sobě bratra svého a řekl mu: "Já jsem bratr tvůj a nermuť se kvůli tomu, co oni na mně kdysi spáchali!"
null.verse 12:70: A když je opatřil zásobami, umístil pohár do sedla bratra svého a potom dal rozhlásit hlasatelem: "Lidé karavany, vy jste věru zloději!"
null.verse 12:71: I řekli, zatímco se k nim blížili: "Co vlastně hledáte?"
null.verse 12:72: Odpověděli: "Hledáme pohár králův; a ten, kdo jej přinese, dostane za odměnu velbloudí náklad.
null.verse 12:73: Při Bohu, řekli bratři, "vždyť dobře víte, že nepřišli jsme páchat v zemi nepravosti - my věru nejsme zloději žádní.
null.verse 12:74: Odpověděli: "Jaká má být odplata toho, jenž jej ukradl, ukáže-li se, že jste lháři?"
null.verse 12:75: Odpověděli: "Odplatou toho, v jehož sedle se nalezne ten pohár, budiž, aby vám byl vydán jako otrok.
null.verse 12:76: A začal prohledávat vaky jejich dříve, než vak bratra svého, až nakonec vytáhl pohár z vaku bratra svého.
null.verse 12:77: A řekli Josefovi bratři: "Jestliže kradl, tedy již jeden z jeho bratří kradl před ním.
null.verse 12:78: Odpověděli: "Ó mocný, on má starého a letitého otce, vezmi jednoho z nás místo něho, neboť vidíme, žes jedním z těch, kdož dobro konají.
null.verse 12:79: Řekl: "Bůh mě chraniž vzít někoho jiného než toho, u něhož jsme nalezli svůj majetek, vždyť bychom byli nespravedliví!"
null.verse 12:80: A když se v něm zklamali, radili se tajně a nejstarší z nich řekl: "Což nevíte, že otec náš zavázal nás úmluvou před Bohem a že jsme se již předtím dopustili nespravedlnosti vůči Josefovi? Neopustím tuto zemi, dokud mi to otec můj nedovolí nebo dokud nerozhodne Bůh v můj prospěch - a On nejlepší je rozhodčí.
null.verse 12:81: Vraťte se k otci našemu a řekněte mu:, Otče náš, syn tvůj kradl a my dosvědčujeme jen to, co známe, a žádné tajemství nechováme.
null.verse 12:82: Zeptej se obyvatel města, kde jsme byli, a lidí karavany, se kterou jsme šli, že vskutku pravdu hovoříme.
null.verse 12:83: I pravil Jakub: "Ó nikoliv, to duše vaše vás svedly ve věci té - leč trpělivost je překrásná a snad Bůh mi je navrátí všechny, vždyť On vševědoucí je i moudrý.
null.verse 12:84: A odvrátil se od nich a zvolal: "Ó jak smutno je mi po Josefovi!" A zbělely oči jeho od zármutku a byl sklíčen.
null.verse 12:85: I řekli: "Při Bohu, což nepřestaneš vzpomínat na Josefa, dokud nezeslábneš zármutkem anebo se nezahubíš?"
null.verse 12:86: Řekl: "Žaluji zármutek svůj i lítost jedině Bohu a vím od Boha to, co vy nevíte.
null.verse 12:87: Synové moji, jděte a pátrejte po Josefovi a bratru jeho! A neztrácejte naději v laskavost Boží, vždyť jen lidé nevěřící ztrácejí naději v laskavost Boží!"
null.verse 12:88: Když pak přišli k Josefovi, pravili: "Ó mocný, přišlo na nás a rodinu naši neštěstí.
null.verse 12:89: I řekl: "Zdaž jste si vědomi toho, co jste udělali Josefovi a bratru jeho ve své pošetilosti?"
null.verse 12:90: Pravili: "Jsi vskutku Josef?" Odpověděl: "Ano, já jsem Josef a toto je můj bratr.
null.verse 12:91: Pravili: "Při Bohu, Bůh ti dal vskutku přednost před námi, zatímco my byli jsme věru hříšníci!"
null.verse 12:92: Odpověděl: "Nechť na vás dnes nepadne žádná výčitka! Bůh vám odpustí, vždyť On nejslitovnější je ze slitovníků!
null.verse 12:93: Odejděte s touto mou košilí a vložte ji na tvář otce mého a on znovu nabude zraku! A potom ke mně přijďte s celou rodinou svou všichni!"
null.verse 12:94: A když se karavana vracela, pravil otec jejich: "Já doopravdy cítím vůni Josefovu! Kéž byste mne nepokládali za blouznivce.
null.verse 12:95: Odpověděli: "Při Bohu, tys opět ve starém svém bludu!"
null.verse 12:96: A když přišel posel se zvěstí radostnou a vložil mu košili na tvář, stal se Jakub opět vidoucím a řekl: "Což neřekl jsem vám, že vím od Boha to, co vy nevíte?"
null.verse 12:97: Pravili: "Otče náš, pros za nás Boha o odpuštění hříchů našich, vždyť my věru jsme byli hříšníky.
null.verse 12:98: Řekl: "Budu prosit Pána svého o odpuštění pro vás a On věru je odpouštějící, slitovný.
null.verse 12:99: A když všichni přišli k Josefovi, přitáhl blízko k sobě rodiče své a řekl: "Vstupte do Egypta v bezpečí, chce-li tomu Bůh!"
null.verse 12:100: A uvedl rodiče své na trůn, zatímco ostatní se mu klaněli padajíce na tváře.
null.verse 12:101: Pane můj, Tys mne obdařil částí moci královské a naučils mne výkladu záhad; tvůrce nebes a země, Tys mým ochráncem na tomto i onom světě, povolej mne k Sobě oddaného do vůle Tvé a připoj mne k bezúhonným!"
null.verse 12:102: A toto je jedna ze zvěstí o nepoznatelném, jež ti zjevujeme, neboť tys nebyl u nich, když shodli se vespolek na svém činu a úklady strojili.
null.verse 12:103: Však většina lidí, i kdybys po tom sebevíce toužil, nebude věřit!
null.verse 12:104: Nežádáš od nich za to odměnu žádnou a není to leč připomenutí lidstvu veškerému.
null.verse 12:105: Kolik je na nebesích i na zemi znamení, kolem nichž chodí a od nichž se odvracejí!
null.verse 12:106: Mnozí z nich v Boha nevěří, aniž by k Němu zároveň jiné nepřidružovali.
null.verse 12:107: Což jsou si tak jisti, že nepostihne je úder trestu Božího anebo že je nezastihne Hodina znenadání, aniž o tom budou mít tušení?
null.verse 12:108: Rci: "Toto je cesta má.
null.verse 12:109: A také před tebou jsme vyslali pouze lidi z obyvatel měst, jimž dostalo se vnuknutí.
null.verse 12:110: A když si pak poslové zoufali a již se domnívali, že za lháře jsou pokládáni, přišla k nim Naše pomoc vítězná.
null.verse 12:111: A v příbězích jejich je věru mnoho příkladů pro ty, kdož rozumem jsou obdařeni.

null.verse 12:2: Wij hebben het geopenbaard - als de Arabische Koran- opdat je mag begrijpen.
null.verse 12:3: Wij verhalen u het schoonste verhaal door u deze Koran te openbaren, ofschoon je voorheen onwetend was.
null.verse 12:4: Toen Jozef tot zijn vader zei: "O mijn vader, (in mijn droom) zag ik elf sterren en de zon en de maan en ik zag ze zich voor mij neerwerpen.
null.verse 12:5: Hij zeide: "O, mijn zoon, verhaal uw broedars uw droom niet, anders zullen zij plannen tegen u smeden, want Satan is een openlijke vijand der mensen.
null.verse 12:6: "En zo zal uw Heer u verkiezen en u de verklaring der dingen onderwijzen en Zijn gunst aan u en aan de familie van Jacob vervohnaken, zoals Hij die voordien aan twee uwer voorvaderen, Abraham en Izaak had voltooid.
null.verse 12:7: Voorzeker, er zijn voor de zoekers (naar waarheid) tekenen in (de geschiedenis van) Jozef en zijn broeders.
null.verse 12:8: Toen zij zeiden: "Voorwaar, Jozef en zijn broeder zijn onze vader liever dan wij, ofschoon wij een sterke groep zijn.
null.verse 12:9: "Doodt Jozef of verdrijft hem naar een (ver) land, zodat uw vaders gunst uitsluitend voor u moge zijn, waarna je een rechtvaardig volk zult worden.
null.verse 12:10: Eén hunner zeide: "Doodt Jozef niet, maar als je iets moet doen werpt hem dan op de bodem van een diepe put; iemand uit een karavaan zal hem opnemen.
null.verse 12:11: Zij zeiden: "O, onze vader, waarom vertrouw je ons niet aangaande Jozef, hoewel wij hem welgezind zijn?"
null.verse 12:12: "Zend hem morgen met ons mede, opdat hij zich moge vermaken en spelen en wij zullen voorzeker zijn bewakers zijn.
null.verse 12:13: Hij zeide: "Het verdriet mij, dat je hem zoudt medenemen en ik vrees, dat de wolf hem zal verslinden terwijl je niet op hem let.
null.verse 12:14: Zij zeiden: "Indien de wolf hem zou verslinden terwijl wij een sterke groep vormen, dan zijn wij inderdaad de verliezers.
null.verse 12:15: Toen zij hem medenamen, kwamen zij overeen hem op de bodem van een diepe put neer te laten en Wij zonden hem een openbaring: "Gij; zult hun van deze zaak vertellen zonder dat zij het beseffen.
null.verse 12:16: ’s Avonds kwamen zij wenend tot hun vader.
null.verse 12:17: En zeiden: "O, onze vader, wij hielden een wedloop en lieten Jozef met onze goederen achter en de wolf verslond hem; maar zelfs al spreken wij de waarheid, zul je ons niet geloven.
null.verse 12:18: En zij brachten zijn hemd met bloed, dat niet van hem was.
null.verse 12:19: Er kwam een karavaan langs en deze zond een waterputter, die zijn emmer neerliet.
null.verse 12:20: Zij verkochten hem voor een geringe prijs, een paar zilverstukken, want zij waren onverschillig jegens hem.
null.verse 12:21: En de Egyptenaar, die hem kocht, zeide tot zijn vrouw: "Maak zijn verblijf behoorlijk.
null.verse 12:22: Toen hij volwassen was, schonken Wij hem oordeel en kennis; zo belonen Wij de goeden.
null.verse 12:23: En zij, in wier huis hij was, zocht hem (tegen zijn wil) te verleiden.
null.verse 12:24: En zij nam een besluit betreffende hem en hij nam een besluit betreffende haar.
null.verse 12:25: En zij holden beiden naar de deur en zij scheurde zijn hemd van achteren en zij ontmoetten haar echtgenoot aan de deur.
null.verse 12:26: Hij (Jozef) zeide: "Zij is het die mij tegen mijn wil zocht te verleiden.
null.verse 12:27: Maar als zijn hemd van achteren is gescheurd, heeft zij gelogen en behoort hij tot de waarachtigen.
null.verse 12:28: Toen hij (haar man) zag dat zijn hemd van achteren was gescheurd, zeide hij: "Dit is zeker een list van u, vrouwen.
null.verse 12:29: "O, Jozef, wend u hiervan af en gij (vrouw), vraag vergiffenis voor uw zonde.
null.verse 12:30: En de vrouwen in de stad zeiden: "De vrouw van Aziez zoekt haar slaaf tegen zijn wil te verleiden.
null.verse 12:31: En toen zij van hun plannen hoorde, nodigde zij haar uit en bereidde haar een maaltijd en gaf ieder een mes en zeide dan (tot Jozef): "Ga naar hen toe.
null.verse 12:32: Zij zeide: "Dit is hij nu over wie je mij beschuldigd, ik zocht hem werkelijk tegen zijn wil te verleiden, maar hij redde zich.
null.verse 12:33: Hij (Jozef) zeide: "O mijn Heer, ik zou de gevangenis verkiezen boven hetgeen waartoe zij mij roepen; tenzij Gij haar list van mij afwendt zal ik mij tot haar neigen en tot de onwetenden behoren.
null.verse 12:34: Daarom verhoorde zijn Heer zijn gebed en wendde hun list van hem af.
null.verse 12:35: Dus kwam het hun (mannen) voor, nadat zij de tekenen van zijn onschuld hadden gezien, dat zij hem voor een tijd gevangen moesten nemen.
null.verse 12:36: En er gingen met hem twee jonge mannen de gevangenis binnen.
null.verse 12:37: Hij antwoordde: "Het voedsel, dat u wordt gegeven, zal niet tot u komen, voordat ik u de verklaring er van heb gegeven.
null.verse 12:38: "En ik volg de godsdienst van mijn vaderen, Abraham, Izaak en Jacob.
null.verse 12:39: "O, mijn twee medegevangenen, zijn verscheidene Heren beter of is God, de Ene, de Opperste beter?"
null.verse 12:40: "Gij aanbidt naast God niets, dan ijdele namen die je hebt uitgedacht, jij en uw vaderen; God heeft daar geen gezag voor neergezonden.
null.verse 12:41: "O mijn twee medegevangenen, wat één uwer betreft, hij zal wijn voor zijn Heer schenken en wat de ander betreft, hij zal worden gekruisigd, zodat de vogels van zijn hoofd zullen eten.
null.verse 12:42: En hij zeide tot degene van hen, van wie hij wist dat hij bevrijd zou worden: "Vermeld mij bij uw heer.
null.verse 12:43: En de koring (van Egypte) zeide: "Ik zag zeven vette koeien, die door zeven magere koeien werden verslonden en zeven groene korenaren en zeven verwelkte aren.
null.verse 12:44: Zij antwoordden: "Het zijn verwarde dromen en wij kennen de verklaring van zulke dromen niet.
null.verse 12:45: En degene van de twee die bevrijd was, herinnerde zich na enige tijd Jozef, en zeide toen: "Ik zal u de verklaring er van laten weten, zend mij daarom.
null.verse 12:46: "O, Jozef! gij man der waarheid, leg ons de betekenis uit van zeven vette koeien die door zeven magere worden verslonden en van zeven groene korenaren en andere verwelkte aren opdat ik tot het volk moge terugkeren, zodat zij mogen weten.
null.verse 12:47: Hij antwoordde: "Gij zult zeven jaren lang voortdurend zaaien en wat je maait in de aar laten, met uitzondering van een weinig, dat je zult eten.
null.verse 12:48: "Dan zullen er nadien zeven harde jaren komen, die al hetgeen je van te voren hebt opgeslagen zal verteren, met uitzondering van een weinig dat je zult bewaren.
null.verse 12:49: "Dan zal er nadien een jaar komen, waarin de mensen zullen worden geholpen en waarin zij (vruchten) zullen persen.
null.verse 12:50: En de koning zeide: "Brengt hem tot mij.
null.verse 12:51: Hij, (de koning) zeide tot de vrouwen: "Wat was het geval met u toen gij Jozef tegen zijn wil zocht te verleiden?" Zij zeiden: "God zij verheerlijkt.
null.verse 12:52: "Dit is, opdat hij moge weten dat ik hem in zijn afwezigheid niet ontrouw was en dat God het plan van de ontrouwe mensen niet laat slagen.
null.verse 12:53: "En ik verklaar mijzelf niet vrij (van zwakheid) te zijn, want het menselijke, ik’ spoort tot het kwade aan, uitgezonderd dat waarover mijn Heer barmhartigheid betoont.
null.verse 12:54: En de koning zeide: "Brengt hem bij mij, ik wil hem voor mijzelf houden.
null.verse 12:55: Hij antwoordde: "Stel mij aan over de schatten van het land want ik ben een deskundig bewaarder.
null.verse 12:56: En zo vestigden Wij Jozef in het land.
null.verse 12:57: En het loon van het Hiernamaals is zeker beter voor degenen die geloven en God vrezen.
null.verse 12:58: En Jozefs broeders kwamen en gingen bij hem binnen en hij herkende hen, maar zij herkenden hem niet.
null.verse 12:59: En toen hij hen van levensmiddelen had voorzien, zeide hij: "Brengt mij uw broeder van vaderskant.
null.verse 12:60: "Maar indien je hem niet tot mij brengt dan zal er van mij geen maat (koren) voor u zijn noch zul je in mijn nabijheid komen.
null.verse 12:61: Zij antwoordden: "Wij zullen trachten zijn vader hiertoe over te halen, wij zullen het voorzeker kunnen doen.
null.verse 12:62: En hij (Jozef) zeide tot zijn dienaren: "Stopt hun geld in de zadeltassen, dat zij het mogen herkennen, wanneer zij tot hun familie terugkeren, opdat zij terug mogen komen.
null.verse 12:63: En toen zij tot hun vader terugkeerden, zeiden zij: "Onze vader, een (verdere) maat is ons ontzegd, zend daarom onze broeder met ons mede, opdat wij onze maat (koren) mogen verkrijgen en wij zullen zeker op hem passen.
null.verse 12:64: Hij (Jacob) antwoordde: "Zal ik u hem toevertrouwen, zoals ik u voorheen zijn broeder toevertrouwde? Maar God is de beste Beschermer en Hij is de Genadigste der genadigen.
null.verse 12:65: En toen zij hun reisgoederen openden, vonden zij hun geld aan hen teruggegeven.
null.verse 12:66: Hij (Jacob) zeide: "Ik zal hem niet met u meezenden voordat gij mij een ernstige belofte aflegt in de naam van God, dat gij hem zeker tot mij zult brengen tenzij gij allen omsingeld zoudt worden.
null.verse 12:67: En hij zeide: "O mijn zonen, gaat niet door één poort binnen maar gaat door verschillende poorten binnen; en ik kan u in niets tegen God helpen.
null.verse 12:68: Maar toen zij (de stad) binnen gingen zoals hun vader hen had bevolen, kon hen dit tegen God toch niets baten; het was slechts dat Jacob zijn zin gedaan kreeg, want hij had voorzeker grote kennis, omdat Wij hem hadden onderwezen, maar de meeste mensen weten het niet.
null.verse 12:69: En toen zij Jozef bezochten, huisvestte deze zijn broeder bij zich.
null.verse 12:70: En toen hij hen van hun provisie had voorzien, legde hij een drinkbeker in zijn broeders zadeltas.
null.verse 12:71: Zij vroegen, zich tot hem wendend: "Wat mist gij?"
null.verse 12:72: Men antwoordde: "Wij missen des konings maatkop en wie hem brengt zal een kameellast koren ontvangen en ik ben er borg voor.
null.verse 12:73: Zij antwoordden: "Bij God, je weet goed, dat wij niet kwamen om slecht in het land te handelen en wij zijn geen dieven.
null.verse 12:74: Zij (de Egyptenaren) zeiden: "Wat zal er dan de straf voor zijn als gij leugenaars zijt?"
null.verse 12:75: Zij antwoordden: "De straf er voor zal zijn: hij, in wiens zadeltas ze wordt gevonden zal zelf de boete er voor zijn.
null.verse 12:76: Daarna begon hij met (het onderzoek van) hun tassen alvorens de tas van zijn broeder (te onderzoeken); dan nam men hem (drinkbeker) uit zijn broeders tas.
null.verse 12:77: Zij (zijn broeders) zeiden: "Als deze heeft gestolen, had zijn broeder voorheen ook diefstal gepleegd.
null.verse 12:78: Zij zeiden: "O Aziez, hij heeft een zeer oude vader, neem daarom één onzer in zijn plaats, want wij zien dat je tot degenen behoort die goed doen.
null.verse 12:79: Hij (Jozef) zeide: "God verhoede, dat wij iemand anders dan hem zouden nemen bij wie wij ons eigendom vonden; want dan zouden wij zeker onrechtvaardig zijn.
null.verse 12:80: En toen zij wanhoopten trokken zij zich terug om in afzondering te beraadslagen.
null.verse 12:81: "Keert gij tot uw vader terug en zegt: ’Onze vader uw zoon heeft gestolen en wij hebben alleen hetgeen wij wisten vermeld en wij konden waarlijk over het ongeziene niet waken.
null.verse 12:82: ’En vraag het volk der stad waarin wij waren en de karavaan waarmee wij reisden en wij spreken voorzeker de waarheid.
null.verse 12:83: Hij (hun vader) zeide: "Neen, uw ziel heeft een groot iets voor u gering gemaakt.
null.verse 12:84: En hij wendde zich van hen af en zeide: "O ik heb verdriet over Jozef.
null.verse 12:85: Zij zeiden: "Bij God, je zult niet ophouden over Jozef te praten, totdat je bent weggekwijnd of totdat je ten gronde gaat.
null.verse 12:86: Hij antwoordde: "Ik klaag alleen over mijn zorg en verdriet tot God en ik weet van God, wat je niet weet.
null.verse 12:87: "O mijn zonen, gaat en zoekt naar Jozef en zijn broeder en wanhoopt niet aan de genade van God, want niemand wanhoopt aan God’s barmhartigheid dan het ongelovige volk.
null.verse 12:88: En toen zij (opnieuw) voor hem (Jozef) kwamen, zeiden zij: "O, Aziez, armoede heeft ons en onze familie getroffen en wij hebben een armzalige geldsom meegebracht, geef ons daarvoor de volle maat en wees liefdadig.
null.verse 12:89: Hij zeide: "Weet je wat je Jozef en zijn broeder aandeedt, toen je onwetend waart?"
null.verse 12:90: Zij vroegen.
null.verse 12:91: Zij antwoordden: "Bij God, waarlijk God heeft u boven ons verkozen en wij zijn inderdaad zondaren geweest.
null.verse 12:92: Hij (Jozef) zeide: "Heden zij er geen verwijt tegen u: Moge God u vergeven, Hij is de Genadigste der genadigen.
null.verse 12:93: "Gaat met dit hemd van mij en legt het voor het aangezicht van mijn vader neer; hij zal het begrijpen.
null.verse 12:94: En toen de karavaan (uit Egypte) vertrok, zeide hun vader: "Ik bemerk voorzeker de geur van Jozef, zelfs al zie je mij voor zwakzinnig aan.
null.verse 12:95: Zij antwoordden: "Bij God, je houdt zeker aan uw oude dwaling vast.
null.verse 12:96: En toen de drager van de blijde tijding kwam, legde hij het (hemd) voor hem (Jacob) neer zodat hij zekerheid verkreeg.
null.verse 12:97: Zij antwoordden: "O, onze vader, vraag voor ons vergiffenis voor onze zonden: wij zijn inderdaad zondaren geweest.
null.verse 12:98: Hij (Jacob) zeide: "Ik zal mijn Heer om vergiffenis voor u vragen.
null.verse 12:99: En toen zij tot Jozef kwamen, huisvestte hij zijn ouders bij zich en zeide: "Komt zoals het God behaagt Egypte in vrede binnen.
null.verse 12:100: Hij hief zijn ouders op de troon en zij wierpen zich voor hem neer.
null.verse 12:101: "O, mijn Heer, Gij hebt mij macht gegeven en de verklaring van dromen onderwezen.
null.verse 12:102: Dit behoort tot de tijdingen van het verborgene die Wij u (o Profeet ) openbaren.
null.verse 12:103: En de meeste mensen willen niet geloven zelfs al wens je het vurig.
null.verse 12:104: Gij vraagt er hun geen beloning voor.
null.verse 12:105: En hoeveel tekenen zijn er niet in de hemelen en op aarde waaraan zij, zich afwendend, voorbijgaan!
null.verse 12:106: En de meesten hunner geloven niet in God, zonder medegoden aan Hem toe te schrijven.
null.verse 12:107: Voelen zij zich dan nu veilig voor het komen van een overweldigende straf over hen van God of voor het onverwacht komen van het Uur over hen, terwijl zij het niet bemerken?
null.verse 12:108: Zeg: "Dit is mijn weg: ik roep tot God in zeker weten, ik en mijn volgelingen.
null.verse 12:109: En Wij zonden vóór u slechts mensen uit de inwoners der steden, die Wij inspireerden.
null.verse 12:110: Totdat, wanneer de boodschappers wanhoopten en zij dachten dat zij voor leugenaars verden gehouden, Onze hulp tot hen kwam en dan werd gered, wie Ons behaagde.
null.verse 12:111: Er is in hun verhaal gewis een les voor mensen van begrip.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:2: Lo! We have revealed it, a Lecture in Arabic, that ye may understand.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:3: We narrate unto thee (Muhammad) the best of narratives in that We have inspired in thee this Qur’an, though aforetime thou wast of the heedless.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:4: When Joseph said unto his father: O my father! Lo! I saw in a dream eleven planets and the sun and the moon, I saw them prostrating themselves unto me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:5: He said: O my dear son! Tell not thy brethren of thy vision, lest they plot a plot against thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:6: Thus thy Lord will prefer thee and will teach thee the interpretation of events, and will perfect His grace upon thee and upon the family of Jacob as He perfected it upon thy forefathers, Abraham and Isaac.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:7: Verily in Joseph and his brethren are signs (of Allah’s Sovereignty) for the inquiring.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:8: When they said: Verily Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we are, many though we be.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:9: (One said): Kill Joseph or cast him to some (other) land, so that your father’s favour may be all for you, and (that) ye may afterward be righteous folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:10: One among them said: Kill not Joseph but, if ye must be doing, fling him into the depth of the pit; some caravan will find him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:11: They said: O our father! Why wilt thou not trust us with Joseph, when lo! we are good friends to him ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:12: Send him with us to-morrow that he may enjoy himself and play.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:13: He said: Lo! in truth it saddens me that ye should take him with you, and I fear less the wolf devour him while ye are heedless of him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:14: They said: If the wolf should devour him when we are (so strong) a band, then surely we should have already perished.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:15: Then, when they led him off, and were of one mind that they should place him in the depth of the pit, We inspired in him: Thou wilt tell them of this deed of theirs when they know (thee) not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:16: And they came weeping to their father in the evening.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:17: Saying: O our father! We went racing one with another, and left Joseph by our things, and the wolf devoured him, and thou believest not our saying even when we speak the truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:18: And they came with false blood on his shirt.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:19: And there came a caravan, and they sent their waterdrawer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:20: And they sold him for a low price, a number of silver coins; and they attached no value to him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:21: And he of Egypt who purchased him said unto his wife: Receive him honourably.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:22: And And when he reached his prime We gave him wisdom and knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:23: And she, in whose house he was, asked of him an evil act.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:24: She verily desired him, and he would have desired her if it had not been that he saw the argument of his Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:25: And they raced with one another to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and they met her lord and master at the door.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:26: (Joseph) said: She it was who asked of me an evil act.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:27: And if his shirt is torn from behind, then she hath lied and he is of the truthful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:28: So when he saw his shirt torn from behind, he said: Lo! this is of the guile of you women.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:29: O Joseph! Turn away from this, and thou, (O woman), ask forgiveness for thy sin.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:30: And women in the city said: The ruler’s wife is asking of her slave-boy an ill-deed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:31: And when she heard of their sly talk, she sent to them and prepared for them a cushioned couch (to lie on at the feast) and gave to every one of them a knife and said (to Joseph): Come out unto them! And when they saw him they exalted him and cut their hands, exclaiming: Allah Blameless! This is no a human being.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:32: She said: This is he on whose account ye blamed me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:33: He said: O my Lord! Prison is more dear than that unto which they urge me, and if Thou fend not off their wiles from me I shall incline unto them and become of the foolish.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:34: So his Lord heard his prayer and fended off their wiles from him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:35: And it seemed good to them (the men-folk) after they had seen the signs (of his innocence) to imprison him for a time.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:36: And two young men went to prison with him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:37: He said: The food which ye are given (daily) shall not come unto you but I shall tell you the interpretation ere it cometh unto you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:38: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac and Jacob.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:39: O my fellow-prisoners! Are divers lords better, or Allah the One, Almighty ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:40: Those whom ye worship beside Him are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:41: O my two fellow-prisoners! As for one of you, he will pour out wine for his lord to drink; and as for the other, he will be crucified so that the birds will eat from his head.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:42: And he said unto him of the twain who he knew would be released: Mention me in the presence of thy lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:43: And the king said: Lo! I saw in a dream seven fat kine which seven lean were eating, and seven green ears of corn and other (seven) dry.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:44: They answered: Jumbled dreams! And we are not knowing in the interpretation of dreams.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:45: And he of the two who was released, and (now) at length remembered, said: I am going to announce unto you the interpretation, therefore send me forth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:46: (And when he came to Joseph in the prison, he exclaimed): Joseph! O thou truthful one! Expound for us the seven fat kine which seven lean were eating and the seven green ears of corn and other (seven) dry, that I may return unto the people, so that they may know.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:47: He said: Ye shall sow seven years as usual, but that which ye reap, leave it in the ear, all save a little which ye eat.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:48: Then after that will come seven hard years which will devour all that ye have prepared for them, save a little of that which ye have stored.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:49: Then, after that, will come a year when the people will have plenteous crops and when they will press (wine and oil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:50: And the king said: Bring him unto me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:51: He (the king) (then sent for those women and) said: What happened when ye asked an evil act of Joseph ? They answered: Allah Blameless! We know no evil of him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:52: (Then Joseph said: I asked for) this, that he (my lord) may know that I betrayed him not in secret, and that surely Allah guideth not the snare of the betrayers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:54: And the king said: Bring him unto me that I may attach him to my person.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:55: He said: Set me over the storehouses of the land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:56: Thus gave We power to Joseph in the land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:57: And the reward of the Hereafter is better, for those who believe and ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:58: And Joseph’s brethren came and presented themselves before him, and he knew them but they knew him not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:59: And when he provided them with their provision he said: Bring unto me a brother of yours from your father.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:60: And if ye bring him not unto me, then there shall be no measure for you with me, nor shall ye draw near.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:61: They said: We will try to win him from his father: that we will surely do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:62: He said unto his young men: Place their merchandise in their saddlebags, so that they may know it when they go back to their folk, and so will come again.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:63: So when they went back to their father they said: O our father! The measure is denied us, so send with us our brother that we may obtain the measure, surely we will guard him well.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:64: He said: Can I entrust him to you save as I entrusted his brother to you aforetime ? Allah is better at guarding, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:65: And when they opened their belongings they discovered that their merchandise had been returned to them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:66: He said: I will not send him with you till ye give me an undertaking in the name of Allah that ye will bring him back to me, unless ye are surrounded.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:67: And he said: O my sons! Go not in by one gate; go in by different gates.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:68: And when they entered in the manner which their father had enjoined, it would have naught availed them as against Allah; it was but a need of Jacob’s soul which he thus satisfied; and lo! he was a lord of knowledge because We had taught him; but most of mankind know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:69: And when they went in before Joseph, he took his brother unto him, saying: Lo! I, even I, am thy brother, therefore sorrow not for what they did.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:70: And when he provided them with their provision, he put the drinking-cup in his brother’s saddlebag, and then a crier cried: O camel-riders! Lo! ye are surely thieves!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:71: They cried, coming toward them: What is it ye have lost ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:72: They said: We have lost the king’s cup, and he who bringeth it shall have a camel-load, and I (said Joseph) am answerable for it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:73: They said: By Allah, well ye know we came not to do evil in the land, and are no thieves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:74: They said: And what shall be the penalty for it, if ye prove liars ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:75: They said: The penalty for it! He in whose bag (the cup) is found, he is the penalty for it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:76: Then he (Joseph) began the search with their bags before his brother’s bag, then he produced it from his brother’s bag.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:77: They said: If he stealeth, a brother of his stole before.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:78: They said: O ruler of the land! Lo! he hath a very aged father, so take one of us instead of him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:79: He said: Allah forbid that we should seize save him with whom we found our property; then truly we should be wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:80: So, When they despaired of (moving) him, they conferred together apart.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:81: Return unto your father and say: O our father! Lo! thy son hath stolen.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:82: Ask the township where we were, and the caravan with which we travelled hither.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:83: (And when they came unto their father and had spoken thus to him) he said: Nay, but your minds have beguiled you into something.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:84: And he turned away from them and said: Alas, my grief for Joseph! And his eyes were whitened with the sorrow that he was suppressing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:85: They said: By Allah, thou wilt never cease remembering Joseph till thy health is ruined or thou art of those who perish!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:86: He said: I expose my distress and anguish only unto Allah, and I know from Allah that which ye know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:87: Go, O my sons, and ascertain concerning Joseph and his brother, and despair not of the Spirit of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:88: And when they came (again) before him (Joseph) they said: O ruler! Misfortune hath touched us and our folk, and we bring but poor merchandise, so fill for us the measure and be charitable unto us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:89: He said: Know ye what ye did unto Joseph and his brother in your ignorance ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:90: They said: Is it indeed thou who art Joseph ? He said: I am Joseph and this is my brother.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:91: They said: By Allah, verily Allah hath preferred thee above us, and we were indeed sinful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:92: He said: Have no fear this day! May Allah forgive you, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:93: Go with this shirt of mine and lay it on my father’s face, he will become (again) a seer; and come to me with all your folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:94: When the caravan departed their father had said: Truly I am conscious of the breath of Joseph, though ye call me dotard.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:95: (Those around him) said: By Allah, lo! thou art in thine old aberration.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:96: Then, when the bearer of glad tidings came, he laid it on his face and he became a seer once more.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:97: They said: O our father! Ask forgiveness of our sins for us, for lo! we were sinful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:98: He said: I shall ask forgiveness for you of my Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:99: And when they came in before Joseph, he took his parents unto him, and said: Come into Egypt safe, if Allah will!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:100: And he placed his parents on the dais and they fell down before him prostrate, and he said: O my father! This is the interpretation of my dream of old.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:101: O my Lord! Thou hast given me (something) of sovereignty and hast taught me (something) of the interpretation of events - Creator of the heavens and the earth! Thou art my Protecting Guardian in the world and the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:102: This is of the tidings of the Unseen which We inspire in thee (Muhammad).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:103: And though thou try much, most men will not believe.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:104: Thou askest them no fee for it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:105: How many a portent is there in the heavens and the earth which they pass by with face averted!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:106: And most of them believe not in Allah except that they attribute partners (unto Him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:107: Deem they themselves secure from the coming on them of a pall of Allah’s punishment, or the coming of the Hour suddenly while they are unaware ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:108: Say: This is my Way: I call on Allah with sure knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:109: We sent not before thee (any messengers) save men whom We inspired from among the folk of the townships - Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them ? And verily the abode of the Hereafter, for those who ward off (evil), is best.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:110: Till, when the messengers despaired and thought that they were denied, then came unto them Our help, and whom We would was saved.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 12:111: In their history verily there is a lesson for men of understanding.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:2: We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur’an, in order that ye may learn wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:3: We do relate unto thee the most beautiful of stories, in that We reveal to thee this (portion of the) Qur’an: before this, thou too was among those who knew it not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:4: Behold! Joseph said to his father: "O my father! I did see eleven stars and the sun and the moon: I saw them prostrate themselves to me!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:5: Said (the father): "My (dear) little son! relate not thy vision to thy brothers, lest they concoct a plot against thee: for Satan is to man an avowed enemy!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:6: "Thus will thy Lord choose thee and teach thee the interpretation of stories (and events) and perfect His favour to thee and to the posterity of Jacob - even as He perfected it to thy fathers Abraham and Isaac aforetime! for God is full of knowledge and wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:7: Verily in Joseph and his brethren are signs (or symbols) for seekers (after Truth).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:8: They said: "Truly Joseph and his brother are loved more by our father than we: But we are a goodly body! really our father is obviously wandering (in his mind)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:9: "Slay ye Joseph or cast him out to some (unknown) land, that so the favour of your father may be given to you alone: (there will be time enough) for you to be righteous after that!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:10: Said one of them: "Slay not Joseph, but if ye must do something, throw him down to the bottom of the well: he will be picked up by some caravan of travellers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:11: They said: "O our father! why dost thou not trust us with Joseph,- seeing we are indeed his sincere well-wishers?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:12: "Send him with us tomorrow to enjoy himself and play, and we shall take every care of him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:13: (Jacob) said: "Really it saddens me that ye should take him away: I fear lest the wolf should devour him while ye attend not to him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:14: They said: "If the wolf were to devour him while we are (so large) a party, then should we indeed (first) have perished ourselves!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:15: So they did take him away, and they all agreed to throw him down to the bottom of the well: and We put into his heart (this Message): ’Of a surety thou shalt (one day) tell them the truth of this their affair while they know (thee) not’
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:16: Then they came to their father in the early part of the night, weeping.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:17: They said: "O our father! We went racing with one another, and left Joseph with our things; and the wolf devoured him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:18: They stained his shirt with false blood.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:19: Then there came a caravan of travellers: they sent their water-carrier (for water), and he let down his bucket (into the well).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:20: The (Brethren) sold him for a miserable price, for a few dirhams counted out: in such low estimation did they hold him!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:21: The man in Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Make his stay (among us) honourable: may be he will bring us much good, or we shall adopt him as a son.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:22: When Joseph attained His full manhood, We gave him power and knowledge: thus do We reward those who do right.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:23: But she in whose house he was, sought to seduce him from his (true) self: she fastened the doors, and said: "Now come, thou (dear one)!" He said: "God forbid! truly (thy husband) is my lord! he made my sojourn agreeable! truly to no good come those who do wrong!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:24: And (with passion) did she desire him, and he would have desired her, but that he saw the evidence of his Lord: thus (did We order) that We might turn away from him (all) evil and shameful deeds: for he was one of Our servants, sincere and purified.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:25: So they both raced each other to the door, and she tore his shirt from the back: they both found her lord near the door.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:26: He said: "It was she that sought to seduce me - from my (true) self.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:27: "But if it be that his shirt is torn from the back, then is she the liar, and he is telling the truth!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:28: So when he saw his shirt,- that it was torn at the back,- (her husband) said: "Behold! It is a snare of you women! truly, mighty is your snare!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:29: "O Joseph, pass this over! (O wife), ask forgiveness for thy sin, for truly thou hast been at fault!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:30: Ladies said in the City: "The wife of the (great) ’Aziz is seeking to seduce her slave from his (true) self: Truly hath he inspired her with violent love: we see she is evidently going astray.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:31: When she heard of their malicious talk, she sent for them and prepared a banquet for them: she gave each of them a knife: and she said (to Joseph), "Come out before them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:32: She said: "There before you is the man about whom ye did blame me! I did seek to seduce him from his (true) self but he did firmly save himself guiltless!.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:33: He said: "O my Lord! the prison is more to my liking than that to which they invite me: Unless Thou turn away their snare from me, I should (in my youthful folly) feel inclined towards them and join the ranks of the ignorant.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:34: So his Lord hearkened to him (in his prayer), and turned away from him their snare: Verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:35: Then it occurred to the men, after they had seen the signs, (that it was best) to imprison him for a time.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:36: Now with him there came into the prison two young men.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:37: He said: "Before any food comes (in due course) to feed either of you, I will surely reveal to you the truth and meaning of this ere it befall you: that is part of the (duty) which my Lord hath taught me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:38: "And I follow the ways of my fathers,- Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; and never could we attribute any partners whatever to God: that (comes) of the grace of God to us and to mankind: yet most men are not grateful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:39: "O my two companions of the prison! (I ask you): are many lords differing among themselves better, or the One God, Supreme and Irresistible?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:40: "If not Him, ye worship nothing but names which ye have named,- ye and your fathers,- for which God hath sent down no authority: the command is for none but God: He hath commanded that ye worship none but Him: that is the right religion, but most men understand not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:41: "O my two companions of the prison! As to one of you, he will pour out the wine for his lord to drink: as for the other, he will hang from the cross, and the birds will eat from off his head.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:42: And of the two, to that one whom he consider about to be saved, he said: "Mention me to thy lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:43: The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine, whom seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn, and seven (others) withered.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:44: They said: "A confused medley of dreams: and we are not skilled in the interpretation of dreams.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:45: But the man who had been released, one of the two (who had been in prison) and who now bethought him after (so long) a space of time, said: "I will tell you the truth of its interpretation: send ye me (therefore).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:46: "O Joseph!" (he said) "O man of truth! Expound to us (the dream) of seven fat kine whom seven lean ones devour, and of seven green ears of corn and (seven) others withered: that I may return to the people, and that they may understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:47: (Joseph) said: "For seven years shall ye diligently sow as is your wont: and the harvests that ye reap, ye shall leave them in the ear,- except a little, of which ye shall eat.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:48: "Then will come after that (period) seven dreadful (years), which will devour what ye shall have laid by in advance for them,- (all) except a little which ye shall have (specially) guarded.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:49: "Then will come after that (period) a year in which the people will have abundant water, and in which they will press (wine and oil).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:50: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:51: (The king) said (to the ladies): "What was your affair when ye did seek to seduce Joseph from his (true) self?" The ladies said: "God preserve us! no evil know we against him!" Said the ’Aziz’s wife: "Now is the truth manifest (to all): it was I who sought to seduce him from his (true) self: He is indeed of those who are (ever) true (and virtuous).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:52: "This (say I), in order that He may know that I have never been false to him in his absence, and that God will never guide the snare of the false ones.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:53: "Nor do I absolve my own self (of blame): the (human) soul is certainly prone to evil, unless my Lord do bestow His Mercy: but surely my Lord is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:54: So the king said: "Bring him unto me; I will take him specially to serve about my own person.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:55: (Joseph) said: "Set me over the store-houses of the land: I will indeed guard them, as one that knows (their importance).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:56: Thus did We give established power to Joseph in the land, to take possession therein as, when, or where he pleased.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:57: But verily the reward of the Hereafter is the best, for those who believe, and are constant in righteousness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:58: Then came Joseph’s brethren: they entered his presence, and he knew them, but they knew him not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:59: And when he had furnished them forth with provisions (suitable) for them, he said: "Bring unto me a brother ye have, of the same father as yourselves, (but a different mother): see ye not that I pay out full measure, and that I do provide the best hospitality?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:60: "Now if ye bring him not to me, ye shall have no measure (of corn) from me, nor shall ye (even) come near me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:61: They said: "We shall certainly seek to get our wish about him from his father: Indeed we shall do it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:62: And (Joseph) told his servants to put their stock-in-trade (with which they had bartered) into their saddle-bags, so they should know it only when they returned to their people, in order that they might come back.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:63: Now when they returned to their father, they said: "O our father! No more measure of grain shall we get (unless we take our brother): So send our brother with us, that we may get our measure; and we will indeed take every care of him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:64: He said: "Shall I trust you with him with any result other than when I trusted you with his brother aforetime? But God is the best to take care (of him), and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:65: Then when they opened their baggage, they found their stock-in-trade had been returned to them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:66: (Jacob) said: "Never will I send him with you until ye swear a solemn oath to me, in God’s name, that ye will be sure to bring him back to me unless ye are yourselves hemmed in (and made powerless).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:67: Further he said: "O my sons! enter not all by one gate: enter ye by different gates.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:68: And when they entered in the manner their father had enjoined, it did not profit them in the least against (the plan of) God: It was but a necessity of Jacob’s soul, which he discharged.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:69: Now when they came into Joseph’s presence, he received his (full) brother to stay with him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:70: At length when he had furnished them forth with provisions (suitable) for them, he put the drinking cup into his brother’s saddle-bag.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:71: They said, turning towards them: "What is it that ye miss?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:72: They said: "We miss the great beaker of the king; for him who produces it, is (the reward of) a camel load; I will be bound by it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:73: (The brothers) said: "By God! well ye know that we came not to make mischief in the land, and we are no thieves!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:74: (The Egyptians) said: "What then shall be the penalty of this, if ye are (proved) to have lied?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:75: They said: "The penalty should be that he in whose saddle-bag it is found, should be held (as bondman) to atone for the (crime).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:76: So he began (the search) with their baggage, before (he came to) the baggage of his brother: at length he brought it out of his brother’s baggage.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:77: They said: "If he steals, there was a brother of his who did steal before (him).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:78: They said: "O exalted one! Behold! he has a father, aged and venerable, (who will grieve for him); so take one of us in his place; for we see that thou art (gracious) in doing good.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:79: He said: "God forbid that we take other than him with whom we found our property: indeed (if we did so), we should be acting wrongfully.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:80: Now when they saw no hope of his (yielding), they held a conference in private.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:81: "Turn ye back to your father, and say, ’O our father! behold! thy son committed theft! we bear witness only to what we know, and we could not well guard against the unseen!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:82: "’Ask at the town where we have been and the caravan in which we returned, and (you will find) we are indeed telling the truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:83: Jacob said: "Nay, but ye have yourselves contrived a story (good enough) for you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:84: And he turned away from them, and said: "How great is my grief for Joseph!" And his eyes became white with sorrow, and he fell into silent melancholy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:85: They said: "By God! (never) wilt thou cease to remember Joseph until thou reach the last extremity of illness, or until thou die!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:86: He said: "I only complain of my distraction and anguish to God, and I know from God that which ye know not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:87: "O my sons! go ye and enquire about Joseph and his brother, and never give up hope of God’s Soothing Mercy: truly no one despairs of God’s Soothing Mercy, except those who have no faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:88: Then, when they came (back) into (Joseph’s) presence they said: "O exalted one! distress has seized us and our family: we have (now) brought but scanty capital: so pay us full measure, (we pray thee), and treat it as charity to us: for God doth reward the charitable.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:89: He said: "Know ye how ye dealt with Joseph and his brother, not knowing (what ye were doing)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:90: They said: "Art thou indeed Joseph?" He said, "I am Joseph, and this is my brother: God has indeed been gracious to us (all): behold, he that is righteous and patient,- never will God suffer the reward to be lost, of those who do right.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:91: They said: "By God! indeed has God preferred thee above us, and we certainly have been guilty of sin!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:92: He said: "This day let no reproach be (cast) on you: God will forgive you, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:93: "Go with this my shirt, and cast it over the face of my father: he will come to see (clearly).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:94: When the caravan left (Egypt), their father said: "I do indeed scent the presence of Joseph: Nay, think me not a dotard.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:95: They said: "By God! truly thou art in thine old wandering mind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:96: Then when the bearer of the good news came, He cast (the shirt) over his face, and he forthwith regained clear sight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:97: They said: "O our father! ask for us forgiveness for our sins, for we were truly at fault.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:98: He said: "Soon will I ask my Lord for forgiveness for you: for he is indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:99: Then when they entered the presence of Joseph, he provided a home for his parents with himself, and said: "Enter ye Egypt (all) in safety if it please God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:100: And he raised his parents high on the throne (of dignity), and they fell down in prostration, (all) before him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:101: "O my Lord! Thou hast indeed bestowed on me some power, and taught me something of the interpretation of dreams and events,- O Thou Creator of the heavens and the earth! Thou art my Protector in this world and in the Hereafter.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:102: Such is one of the stories of what happened unseen, which We reveal by inspiration unto thee; nor wast thou (present) with them then when they concerted their plans together in the process of weaving their plots.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:103: Yet no faith will the greater part of mankind have, however ardently thou dost desire it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:104: And no reward dost thou ask of them for this: it is no less than a message for all creatures.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:105: And how many Signs in the heavens and the earth do they pass by? Yet they turn (their faces) away from them!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:106: And most of them believe not in God without associating (other as partners) with Him!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:107: Do they then feel secure from the coming against them of the covering veil of the wrath of God,- or of the coming against them of the (final) Hour all of a sudden while they perceive not?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:108: Say thou: "This is my way: I do invite unto God,- on evidence clear as the seeing with one’s eyes,- I and whoever follows me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:109: Nor did We send before thee (as apostles) any but men, whom we did inspire,- (men) living in human habitations.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:110: (Respite will be granted) until, when the apostles give up hope (of their people) and (come to) think that they were treated as liars, there reaches them Our help, and those whom We will are delivered into safety.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 12:111: There is, in their stories, instruction for men endued with understanding.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:2: We have sent it down as an Arabic Koran; haply you will understand.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:3: We will relate to thee the fairest of stories in that We have revealed to thee this Koran, though before it thou wast one of the heedless.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:4: When Joseph said to his father, ’Father, I saw eleven stars, and the sun and the moon; I saw them bowing down before me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:5: He said, ’O my son, relate not thy vision to thy brothers, lest they devise against thee some guile.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:6: So will thy Lord choose thee, and teach thee the interpretation of tales, and perfect His blessing upon thee and upon the House of Jacob, as He perfected it formerly on thy fathers Abraham and Isaac; surely thy Lord is All-knowing, All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:7: (In Joseph and his brethren were signs for those who ask questions.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:8: When they said, ’Surely Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we, though we are a band.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:9: Kill you Joseph, or cast him forth into some land, that your father’s face may be free for you, and thereafter you may be a righteous people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:10: One of them said, ’No, kill not Joseph, but cast him into the bottom of the pit and some traveller will pick him out, if you do aught.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:11: They said, ’Father, what ails thee, that thou trustest us not with Joseph? Surely we are his sincere well-wishers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:12: Send him forth with us tomorrow, to frolic and play; surely we shall be watching over him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:13: He said, ’It grieves me that you should go with him, and I fear the wolf may eat him, while you are heedless of him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:14: They said, ’If the wolf eats him, and we a band, then are we losers!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:15: So when they went with him, and agreed to put him in the bottom of the well, and We revealed to him, ’Thou shalt tell them of this their doing when they are unaware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:16: And they came to their father in the evening, and they were weeping.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:17: They said, ’Father, we went running races, and left Joseph behind with our things; so the wolf ate him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:18: And they brought his shirt with false blood on it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:19: Then came travellers, and they sent one of them, a water-drawer, who let down his bucket.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:20: Then they sold him for a paltry price, a handful of counted dirhams; for they set small store by him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:21: He that bought him, being of Egypt, said to his wife, ’Give him goodly lodging, and it may be that he will profit us, or we may take him for our own son.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:22: And when he was fully grown, We gave him judgment and knowledge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:23: Now the woman in whose house he was solicited him, and closed the doors on them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:24: For she desired him; and he would have taken her, but that he saw the proof of his Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:25: They raced to the door; and she tore his shirt from behind.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:26: Said he, ’It was she that solicited me’; and a witness of her folk bore witness, ’If his shirt has been torn from before then she has spoken truly, and he is one of the liars;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:27: but if it be that his shirt has been torn from behind, then she has lied, and he is one of the truthful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:28: When he saw his shirt was torn from behind he said, ’This is of your women’s guile; surely your guile is great.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:29: Joseph, turn away from this; and thou, woman, ask forgiveness of thy crime; surely thou art one of the sinners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:30: Certain women that were in the city said, ’The Governor’s wife has been soliciting her page; he smote her heart with love; we see her in manifest error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:31: When she heard their sly whispers, she sent to them, and made ready for them a repast, then she gave to each one of them a knife.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:33: He said, ’My Lord, prison is dearer to me than that they call me to; yet if Thou turnest not from me their guile, then I shall yearn towards them, and so become one of the ignorant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:34: So his Lord answered him, and He turned away from him their guile; surely He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:35: Then it seemed good to them, after they had seen the signs, that they should imprison him for a while.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:36: And there entered the prison with him two youths.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:37: He said, ’No food shall come to you for your sustenance, but ere it comes to you I shall tell you its interpretation.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:38: And I have followed the creed of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:39: Say, which is better, my fellow-prisoners -- many gods at variance, or God the One, the Omnipotent?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:40: That which you serve, apart from Him, is nothing but names yourselves have named, you and your fathers; God has sent down no authority touching them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:41: Fellow-prisoners, as for one of you, he shall pour wine for his lord; as for the other, he shall be crucified, and birds will eat of his head.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:42: Then he said to the one he deemed should be saved of the two, ’Mention me in thy lord’s presence.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:43: And the king said, ’I saw in a dream seven fat kine, and seven lean ones devouring them; likewise seven green ears of corn, and seven withered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:45: Then said the one who had been delivered, remembering after a time, ’I will myself tell you its interpretation; so send me forth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:46: ’Joseph, thou true man, pronounce to us regarding seven fat kine, that seven lean ones were devouring, seven green ears of corn, and seven withered; haply I shall return to the men, haply they will know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:47: He said, ’You shall sow seven years after your wont; what you have harvested leave in the ear, excepting a little whereof you eat.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:48: Then thereafter there shall come upon you seven hard years, that shall devour what you have laid up for them, all but a little you keep in store.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:49: Then thereafter there shall come a year wherein the people will be succoured and press in season.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:50: The king said, ’Bring him to me!’ And when the messenger came to him, he said, ’Return unto thy lord, and ask of him, "What of the women who cut their hands?" Surely my Lord has knowledge of their guile.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:51: ’What was your business, women,’ he said, ’when you solicited Joseph?’ ’God save us!’ they said.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:52: ’That, so that he may know I betrayed him not secretly, and that God guides not the guile of the treacherous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:53: Yet I claim not that my soul was innocent -- surely the soul of man incites to evil -- except inasmuch as my Lord had mercy; truly my Lord is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:54: The king said, ’Bring him to me! I would attach him to my person.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:55: He said, ’Set me over the land’s storehouses; I am a knowing guardian.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:56: So We established Joseph in the land, to make his dwelling there wherever he would.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:57: Yet is the wage of the world to come better for those who believe, and are godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:58: And the brethren of Joseph came, and entered unto him, and he knew them, but they knew him not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:59: When he had equipped them with their equipment be said, ’Bring me a certain brother of yours from your father.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:60: But if you bring him not to me, there shall be no measure for you with me, neither shall you come nigh me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:61: They said, ’We will solicit him of our father; that we will do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:62: He said to his pages, ’Put their merchandise in their saddlebags; haply they will recognize it when they have turned to their people; haply they will return.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:63: So, when they had returned to their father, they said, ’Father, the measure was denied to us; so send with us our brother, that we may obtain the measure; surely we shall be watching over him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:64: He said, ’And shall I entrust him to you otherwise than as I entrusted before his brother to you? Why, God is the best guardian, and He is the most merciful of the merciful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:65: And when they opened their things, they found their merchandise, restored to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:66: He said, ’Never will I send him with you until you bring me a solemn pledge by God that you will surely bring him back to me unless it be that you are encompassed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:67: He also said, ’O my sons, enter not by one door; enter by separate doors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:68: And when they entered after the manner their father commanded them, it availed them nothing against God; but it was a need in Jacob’s soul that he so satisfied.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:69: And when they entered unto Joseph, he said, taking his brother into his arms, ’I am thy brother; so do not despair of that they have done.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:70: Then, when he had equipped them with their equipment, he put his drinking-cup into the saddlebag of his brother.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:71: They said, turning to them, ’What is it that you are missing?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:72: They said, ’We are missing the king’s goblet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:73: ’By God,’ they said, ’you know well that we came not to work corruption in the land.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:74: They said, ’And what shall be its recompense if you are liars?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:75: They said, ’This shall be its recompense -- in whoever’s saddlebag the goblet is found, he shall be its recompense.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:76: So he made beginning with their sacks, before his brother’s sack, then he pulled it out of his brother’s sack.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:77: They said, ’If he is a thief, a brother of his was a thief before.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 12:78: They said, ’Mighty prince, he has a father, aged and great with years; so take one of us in his place; we see that thou art one of the good-doers.
