Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:2: We have sent it down, as an Arabic Qur’an, so that you may understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:3: By revealing this Qur’an to you, we hereby narrate to you the best narrative, while before this you were among those unaware (of it).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:4: (It happened) when Yūsuf said to his father, “My father, I saw (in dream) eleven stars and the Sun and the Moon; I saw them all fallen prostrate before me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:5: He said, “My son, do not relate your dream to your brothers, lest they should devise a plan against you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:6: And it will be in this way that your Lord will choose you and teach you the correct interpretation of events, and will perfect His bounty upon you and upon the House of Ya‘qūb, as He has perfected it earlier upon your fore-fathers, Ibrāhīm and IsHāq.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:7: Surely, in (the story of) Yūsuf and his brothers, there are signs for those who ask.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:8: (It happened) when they said, “Yūsuf and his brother are dearer to our father than we are, while we are a whole group.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:9: Let us kill Yūsuf, or throw him at some place on earth, and thus your father’s full attention will be devoted for you alone, and after doing that, you may become a righteous people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:10: One of them said, “Do not kill Yūsuf; rather, cast him into the bottom of a pit, so that some wayfarers may pick him up, if you are going to do something anyway.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:11: They said (to Ya‘qūb), “Our father, why is it that you do not trust us about Yūsuf, while we are his well-wishers indeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:12: Send him with us tomorrow, that he may eat and play, and of course, we will remain as guards for him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:13: He said, “It makes me sad that you should take him with you, and I fear that some wolf may eat him up when you are heedless of him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:14: They said, “If a wolf eats him up, while we are a whole group, we are then losers indeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:15: So, when they went away with him and were determined to put him in the bottom of a pit, (they did accordingly).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:16: And at nightfall, they came to their father weeping.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:17: They said, “Father, we went racing with one another, and left Yūsuf with our belongings, and the wolf ate him up.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:18: And they came with fake blood on his shirt.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:19: And some wayfarers came (near the pit in which Yūsuf was thrown), and sent their water-drawer (to bring water for them).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:20: And they sold him for a paltry price, for a few silver-coins, and they had not much interest in him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:21: And the one who bought him from Egypt said to his wife, “Make his stay graceful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:22: And when he reached the prime of his age, We gave him wisdom and knowledge, and this is how We reward those who are good in their deeds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:23: And she, in whose house he was, seduced him towards herself, and bolted the doors, and said, “come on!” He said, “I seek refuge with Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:24: She certainly desired him, and he might have desired her, had he not seen the proof from his Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:25: They raced towards the door, and she ripped his shirt from behind, and they found her master by the door.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:26: He (Yūsuf) said, “It was she who tried to seduce me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:27: and if his shirt was ripped from behind, then she is telling a lie and he is truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:28: So, when he (her husband) saw his shirt ripped from behind, he said, “This is certainly your trickery, O women.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:29: O Yūsuf, ignore this matter, and you (O woman,) seek forgiveness for your sin, for you were guilty infact.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:30: And women in the city said, “The wife of the minister is seducing her youthful slave.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:31: So, when she heard of their taunting comments, she extended an invitation to them and arranged for them a comfortable place (to sit and dine) and gave everyone a knife, and said (to Yūsuf): “come out to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:32: She said, “This is the one about whom you reproached me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:33: He (Yūsuf) said, “My Lord, the prison is dearer to me than what these women invite me to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:34: So, his Lord accepted his prayer and turned their guile away from him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:35: Later on, even after having seen the clear signs (of his innocence), they deemed it proper to imprison him for some time.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:36: And two men entered the prison with him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:37: He said, “No food provided for you shall come to you, but I can give you its description before it comes to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:38: and I have followed the way of my fathers, Ibrāhīm, IsHāq and Ya‘qūb.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:39: O my fellow prisoners, are different gods better or Allah, the One, the All-Dominant?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:40: Whatever you worship, other than Him, are nothing but names you have coined, you and your fathers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:41: “O my fellow prisoners, one of you will serve wine to his master, while the other will be crucified and birds will eat from his head.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:42: And he (Yūsuf) said to the one whom he believed likely to be released out of the two, “Tell your master about me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:43: And (one day) the king said (to his courtiers), “I have seen (in a dream) seven fat cows being eaten by seven lean ones, and seven ears of grain which are green and (seven) others which are dry.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:44: They said, “(It seems to be) a mishmash of dreams, and we do not know the interpretation of dreams.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:45: And said the one who was released (from the prison) out of the two, and recalled (Yūsuf) after a long time, “I shall tell you its interpretation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:46: (Thus he came to the prison and said to Yūsuf “Yūsuf, O the truthful one, tell us about seven fat cows eaten by seven lean ones, and seven ears of grain which are green and (seven) others which are dry, so that I may go back to the people and they may know (the interpretation of the dream.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:47: He said, “You will grow crops for seven years consecutively.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:48: Then seven hard years shall come after that, which shall eat up what you have stored for them, except a little which you preserve (to sow).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:49: Then there shall come after that a year in which people will have rains and in which they will extract juices.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:50: And (when this person went back and told the king about the interpretation of the dream), the king said, “Bring him to me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:51: He (the king) said, “What was your case, O women, when you seduced Yūsuf?” They said, “God forbid, we know of no evil in him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:52: (Then Yūsuf said), “That was because he (the governor) may know that I did not betray him in his absence, and that Allah does not lead the guile of betrayers to success.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:53: And I do not absolve my inner self of blame.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:54: The king said, “Bring him to me, and I shall employ him purely for myself.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:55: He said, “Appoint me to (supervise) the treasures of the land.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:56: And thus We gave Yūsuf power in the land.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:57: And the reward of the Hereafter is surely better for those who believe and constantly observe taqwā.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:58: And came the brothers of Yūsuf and appeared before him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:59: When he equipped them with their provisions, he said, “Bring to me your other brother from your father’s side.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:60: Still, if you do not bring him to me, then you deserve no (further) measure from me, nor shall you approach me any more.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:61: They said, “We shall persuade his father about him and we will certainly do it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:62: And he (Yūsuf) said to his boys, “Put their goods in their camel-packs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:63: So, when they returned to their father, they said, “Father, the (required) measure (of grain) has been withheld from us, therefore, send our brother with us, so that we may receive our full measure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:64: He said, “Shall I trust you about him as I trusted you earlier about his brother? Well, Allah is the best guardian, and He is the Most-Merciful of all the merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:65: When they opened their baggage, they found their goods given back to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:66: He said, “I shall never send him with you until you give me a pledge in the name of Allah that you will definitely bring him back to me, unless you are overpowered (by circumstances).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:67: And he said, “O my sons, do not enter (the city) all of you from the same gate, rather, enter from different gates.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:68: And (recall) when they entered (the city) in the manner their father had advised them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:69: And when they came to Yūsuf, he lodged his brother (Binyamin) with himself.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:70: Later, when he equipped them with their provisions, he placed the bowl in the camel-pack of his brother.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:71: Turning towards them, they said, “What are you missing?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:72: They said, “We are missing the measuring-bowl of the king, and whoever brings it back shall deserve a camel-load, and I stand surety for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:73: They said, “We swear by Allah, you know, we did not come to make mischief in the land, nor have we ever been thieves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:74: They said, “What is the punishment, if you are liars?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:75: They said, “Its punishment? The one in whose saddlebag it is found shall himself be the punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:76: So, he started with their bags before (searching) the bag of his brother, then, recovered it from the bag of his brother.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:77: They said, “If he commits theft, (there is nothing surprising, because) his other brother had committed theft earlier.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:78: They said, “O ‘Azīz, he has a father, a very old man.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:79: He said, “We seek Allah’s refuge from keeping anyone other than him with whom we have found our thing, otherwise we shall be unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:80: So when they lost hope in him, they went aside for consultation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:81: Go back to your father and say, ‘Our father, your son has committed theft, and we do not testify except what we know, and we could not guard against the unseen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:82: Ask (the people of) the town in which we have been, and the caravan with which we have come, and undoubtedly we are truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:83: He (Ya‘qūb) said, “Rather, your inner desires have seduced you to something.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:84: He turned away from them and said, “How sad I am about Yūsuf!” and his eyes turned white with sorrow and he was suppressing (his anger and grief).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:85: They said, “By God, you will not stop remembering Yūsuf until you collapse or perish.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:86: He said, “I do not complain of my anguish and sorrow to anyone but Allah, and I know from Allah what you do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:87: O my sons, go and search for Yūsuf and his brother, and do not lose hope in the mercy of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:88: So, when they came to him (Yūsuf), they said, “‘Azīz, we and our family are struck by distress, and we have brought some goods of very little worth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:89: He said, “Do you know what you did to Yūsuf and his brother when you were ignorant?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:90: They said, “Is it that you are, in fact, Yūsuf?” He said, “I am Yūsuf, and this is my brother.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:91: They said, “We swear by Allah, indeed Allah has given to you preference over us, and we were guilty in fact.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:92: He said, “No reproach upon you today! May Allah forgive you, and He is the Most- Merciful of all the merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:93: Go with this shirt of mine, and put it over the face of my father, and he will turn into a sighted man.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:94: And when the caravan set out (from Egypt), their father (Ya‘qūb) said (in Canaan), “I sense the fragrance of Yūsuf, if you do not take me to be senile.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:95: They said, “By God, you are still in your old fallacy!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:96: So, when came the man with good news, he put it (the shirt) on his face, and he turned into a sighted man.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:97: They said, “Our father, pray to Allah to forgive us our sins.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:98: He said, “I shall pray to my Lord to forgive you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:99: Later, when they came to Yūsuf, he placed his parents near himself and said, “Enter Egypt, God willing, in peace.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:100: And he raised his parents up on the throne, and they all fell before him in prostration.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:101: “My Lord, You have given me power to rule and the knowledge of interpreting events.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:102: That is a part of the reports of the unseen We reveal to you (O Prophet).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:103: Most of the people are not going to believe despite your strong desire for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:104: And you do not demand from them any reward against it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:105: How many a sign there are in the heavens and the Earth, which they pass by and they are heedless to them;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:106: and most of them do not believe in Allah without associating partners with Him in His divinity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:107: Do they feel themselves secure from the visit of Allah’s encircling punishment or from the sudden arrival of the Hour, while they are not conscious of it?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:109: We did not send before you (messengers) other than men from the people of the towns whom We inspired with revelation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:110: (Punishment was often delayed) until when the messengers were in despair and thought that they were wrong in their estimation, Our help came to them, then saved were those whom We willed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 12:111: Surely, in the narratives of these, there is a lesson for the people of understanding.
